discussion.content:
Selected Answer: AC
A. Top N Customers
C. Customers of 2020

To combine two sets, they must be based on the same dimensions. That is, you can combine a set containing the top customers with another set containing the customers that purchased last year
AC. Combined sets must be based on the same dimension
Combined set must be on same dimension so, it is AC.

Which two sets can you combine? (Choose two.)

choices.D: From the dashboard overview page, modify the subscription.

questions.question_text:
You subscribe to a view that delivers a daily email to your inbox.

You want to make the subscription available to other stakeholders.

What should you do?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
B. From the My Content overview page, modify the subscription: In Tableau Server or Tableau Online, the My Content page lists all the content that you own or subscribe to. From this page, you can modify existing subscriptions, including making them available to other stakeholders by adding their email addresses to the subscription. This is the correct place to manage subscriptions.

Selected Answer: A
From the Explore section of your site, select All Workbooks or All Views, or open the project that contains the view you want to subscribe to.

Content type menu
Open a view either directly, or after opening the containing workbook.

On the view toolbar, select Watch > Subscriptions.
Add the Tableau users or groups you want to receive the subscription. To receive a subscription, users must have the View and Download Image/PDF permissions.

If you own the workbook, select Subscribe me.

Selected Answer: B
Correct Ans is B. Subscriptions can be modified on My Content page in the tableau server

Selected Answer: B
B. From the My Content overview page, modify the subscription.

Selected Answer: B
My Content overview: This page provides a comprehensive view of all your saved content, including subscriptions

[Order Date] < TODAY()
AND
DATETRUNC ('year', [Order Date]) = DATETRUNC ('year', TODAY())

questions.question_text:
DRAG DROP
-

You have a data source that contains the following columns.

//IMG//


You want to display year to date (YTD) sales.

How should you complete the formula? (Drag the appropriate Options to the Answer Area and drop into the correct locations.)

//IMG//

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
The aggregation can be changed in the view so you just need to make the calculated field select the correct measure. With A you select the measure depending on the value of the parameter and not the display name

Selected Answer: A
CASE [Pick Measure]
WHEN 1 then [Sales]
WHEN 2 then [Profit]
END

Selected Answer: A
Given answer is correct

Selected Answer: B
Right click the dimension filter->attribute--> select the state and exclude the selected states.
The correct answer is B

choices.B: Right-click the State dimension filter, and then click Attribute.
choices.C: Change the LOD expression to [Region Sales] = {FIXED [Region], [State]: SUM [Sales]}.
choices.A: Right-click the State dimension filter, and then click Add to Context.
choices.D: Drag the LOD expression to the Filters shelf.
